newsitem.title: USA: U.S. trade gap rises 7.8 percent in April.
newsitem.headline: U.S. trade gap rises 7.8 percent in April.

text.p: The U.S. trade deficit in April rose 7.8 percent to $8.4 billion as record exports were not enough to offset record imports, the Department of Commerce said on Thursday.

The department said exports, led by increased sales of telecommunications equipment, rose 0.2 percent to a record $78.36 billion in April. Imports, reflecting strong demand for clothes, toys, sporting goods and other consumer products, rose 0.9 percent to $86.72 billion, the department said.
